Award.AwardTitle: 2016 International Indian Statistical Association conference `Statistical and Data Sciences: A Key to Healthy People, Planet and Prosperity'
Award.AbstractNarration:
The 2016 meeting of the International Indian Statistical Association (IISA) will take place at Oregon State University, from August 18-21, 2016. (See http://blogs.oregonstate.edu/iisa/.) The main objective of the conference is to bring together both well established and emerging young researchers from around the world who are actively pursuing theoretical and methodological research in statistics and data science and their applications in various allied fields. The conference aims to provide a forum for leading experts and young researchers to discuss recent progress in statistical theory and applications and in data science, thereby providing new directions for statistical inference in various fields. It aims to promote education, research and application of statistics, probability and data science throughout the world with a special emphasis on the Indian subcontinent, foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities between various countries as well as among other national/international organizations for the development of statistical and data science, serve the needs of young statisticians and data scientists and encourage cooperative efforts among members in education, research, industry and business.

Oregon State University will host the 2016 meeting of the International Indian Statistical Association (IISA) from August 18-21, 2016. Plenary speakers will be Kanti Mardia (University of Leeds) and Xiao-Li Meng (Harvard University). Keynote speakers include Kathy Ensor (Rice University), Debashis Ghosh (University of Colorado, Denver), Kannan Natarajan (Novartis), and Ajit Tamhane (Northwestern University). Activities for junior researchers include a session on early career development and a student paper competition. This funding will assure the participation of junior researchers and graduate students.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2017 IISA conference on “Statistics and Data Science for better Life, Society and Science” took place in Hyderabad, India on December 27-30. The objective were (1) to promote education, research and application of statistics and probability throughout the world with a special emphasis on the Indian subcontinent, (2) to foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities between various countries as well as among other national/international organizations for the development of Statistical Science, (3) serve the needs of young statisticians and (4) to encourage cooperative efforts among members in education, research, industry and business. For further details, see the conference website:

https://www.intindstat.org/iisaconference2017/index

The PI was on the scientific program committee:

https://www.intindstat.org/iisaconference2017/conferencecommittees

The remaining NSF award was used to partially support 13 junior researchers, graduate students from United States to travel to India and to participate in the conference. All selected junior researchers are recently graduated tenure track assistant professors from prestigious universities at the United States. Furthermore, all PhD students selected from United States are those won the best student paper award. The NSF support where used toward registration, travel fare, lodging and food. Prior approval were taken from Oregon State office of sponsored research and administration on Foreign Travel Authorization. Each individual who received NSF support were notified before their travel on Fly America Act and Open Skies Agreement Guidance. The conference included several keynote and plenary talks from internationally renowned statisticians, and three workshops on adaptive designs, multilevel modeling and applications of discrete data methods. The conference program can be found at

https://www.intindstat.org/iisaconference2017/conferencePrograms
